content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I like sequels

I would suggest adding a test where missing X is not at the corner of the map.
And specifying that the output map width and height should match the inputted one would be nice. That's clear from the test but still

Also, you can cut the Example from the Goal. People can look at the tests and the third one is just a mirrored version of the exp.

And please consider putting some explanation of what "barycenter" is in the statement. Barycenter1 worked since barycenter itself was the focus but here it's different.
I have no idea how to explain quickly what barycenter is tho so yea, maybe It'll just has to be as it is

Please, ping me if you change anything

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Coded in Dart. Should be possible in 5 minutes. I like it best for Fastest.
I was a little reluctant on approving until Tricky popped up, because there weren't any edge cases. Funny, clever test.
The main purpose of this Coc is REVERSE (but it also works for FASTEST and SHORTEST).

Trricky has a useless line or column.
In the output section it says that you must output the N given lines (it implies to keep useless line/column).
The "middle example" is the "definition"
As it's a little bit harder than Barycenter1 i repeat the example in the tests (especially for the REVERSE mode)

Trricky has a useless column but the missing dot is still not in the middle segment. I was talking more like
...X...
X......
...BX..
......X
...X...
v
...X...
X......
..XBX..
......X
...X...
Not a big deal tho, I don't think that anyone can use the missing dot not being in the middle segment.

Oh, I missed "The given N lines" in the output description. Yea, that'll do it.

I still think there should be an explicit definition of the barycenter. For the people that don't know the definition, Fastest will just transform into Reverse.
But it's not that important.
